Billy.goal: Schedule a 1-hour meeting between 09:00 and 17:00 on Monday that fits everyone's calendars.

Maria.goal: Schedule a 1-hour meeting between 09:00 and 17:00 on Monday that fits everyone's calendars.

William.goal: Schedule a 1-hour meeting between 09:00 and 17:00 on Monday that fits everyone's calendars.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate participants' availabilities and produce a PDDL domain and problem (targeting the FastDownwards solver) that schedules the required 1-hour meeting for Monday between 09:00 and 17:00.

public_information: Meeting must be scheduled on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00.
Time slots are considered at 30-minute granularity.
There exists at least one time that fits every participant's existing schedule.

availability.system_prompt: You are a calendar participant agent. Your role is to report your free time intervals between the public work hours given your private busy periods.
You are a calendar participant agent. Your role is to report your free time intervals between the public work hours given your private busy periods.
You are a calendar participant agent. Your role is to report your free time intervals between the public work hours given your private busy periods.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL authoring. Produce a complete PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner that models scheduling a single meeting (duration 60 minutes) on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 given participants' availabilities. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions and resources distinct if representing multiple actors.
